results.title: Pencils
results.brief_description: Scenes showing children and adults writing, drawing, and doodling with every imaginable kind of pencil are intercut with sequences filmed at a factory where pencils are manufactured. The variety of pencils, sizes, shapes, colours and uses are conveyed without narration but with a lively musical score.

results.title: Penance: Sacrament of peace
results.creator_credit: Franciscan Communications Centre and Bruce Bailer
results.brief_description: A dramatisation illustrating the universal story of sin, repentance, reconciliation and peace. Ray Hendricks, driving home from a cocktail party, accidentally strikes a little girl. He tries to cover up his guilt and remorse by attempting to convince himself and others that because he was cleared by the police, he is not guilty of anything. He finally risks the confrontation and visits the little girl. She gives him sympathy because he looks hurt, and her naive assumption of this basic goodness brings him peace.

results.title: Penalty kicks, free kicks and goal keeping
results.brief_description: Begins by dividing the action of taking a penalty kick into its five aspect. Demonstrates the strategies involved in scoring opportunities from direct free kicks near the penalty areas. Santos and Claudio shows the skills associated with goalkeeping.

results.title: Pen point percussion: an introduction to hand-drawn sound of Norman McLaren
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Norman McLaren and Tom Daly
results.brief_description: The first part of this film presents an explanation of the principles and production of synthetic sound in motion pictures, showing Norman McLaren’s experimentation with hand-drawn sounds on film. The film is designed as an introduction to McLaren’s animated productions. An oscilloscope records what various sounds look like - the trembling strings of a guitar, the low tones of a tuba, the crow of a rooster and the human speaking voice. Norman McLaren then demonstrates on a moviola the sounds that emit from a soundtrack on which he has drawn dots, lines and triangles and we note how these sounds are synchronised with the artist’s hand-drawn animations. (6 mins.) Written by Don Peter. Photographed by Lorne C. Batchelor. Music by Louis Applebaum. (Award: Venice). The second part presents Norman McLaren’s experimental film ‘Dots’ made in 1948 which demonstrates his innovative technique and illustrates what can be created by drawing directly onto the picture and soundtrack area of film stock. (2 mins.) Other films in the collection related to this technique include ‘The Eye hears the ear sees’, ‘Synchronomy’ and ‘Loops’. (Awards: Toronto, Salerno, Rome)

results.title: Pembrokeshire, my county
results.creator_credit: Andrew Rice, British Information Services and Ronald Stark
results.brief_description: A film on the Welsh country of Pembrokeshire,, through the seasons, showing the scenic beauty of the countryside, buildings of interest, and something of agriculture and social life of the country. Highlights of the film include shots of abundant wild life of the region, pleasures of sailing at Milford and unique scenes in the Cistercian monastery at Caldey Island.

results.brief_description: Shows pelicans flying together in flocks, building their nests, hatching heir eggs and caring for heir young. Shows the attempts of the young to fly.

results.title: Pelican Island
results.brief_description: Down south in Florida where Ponde De Leon ages ago sought the spring of eternal youth, there is a queer island inhabited by pelicans. Burlington studies the map to see how the pelican get there.

results.title: Pele: the master and his method
results.brief_description: Depicts ball passing mehods, including wall pass, short chip, instep drive etc. Emphasizes role of the receiver and importance of thinking and the use of shouting.

results.title: Peiping family
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and William James
results.brief_description: Describes the daily life of a middle-class educated Chinese family in Peking including scenes of the children being taught in the family home by their mother who is a qualified teacher. This film was made prior to the declaration of the People’s Republic of China in 1949 and is seen through “western” eyes and “western” philosophy.

results.title: Pegged in
results.brief_description: The secret life of a peg! A comic animation of common wooden pegs who, once left alone in a laundry basket, come to life and sprout legs. This quirky short has the pegs getting caught up in a string, one burns itself of an iron, and they all conspire to release two of their fellow pegs from a shirt pocket, in the process cause chaos.
